experience: You and Dr. Ernie both know Siamak Farah, Alex Cone, and 12 others

* Designed and ran onboarding process enabling engineers to be productive their first day on the job* Migrated all financial data from QuickBooks to NetSuite in just four weeks* Managed Google Apps, GitHub, Slack, Confluence and other enterprise systems* Designed and implemented RAML-based API documentation and testing* Implemented Go APIs to automate customer onboarding from NetSuite to our SAAS

Empowering founders to execute on their vision and values via:• Mentoring and Leadership Development• Launch Planning and Execution• Product Strategy and Requirements• Organizational Structure and Process Design• Experience Design and Customer Development

* Designed, Evangelized and Implemented first company-wide Initiative Review Process* Organized, Executed, and Delivered a coordinated product development effort to establish Matterport as the dominant technology company at the Inman SF 2015 Real Estate conference* Developed a comprehensive Platform Roadmap spanning Publishing, Media, and Commerce.

In only 70 days, from a standing start:* Learned, designed, and built an app using Node.js, CoffeeScript & Reactive-Coffee* Recruited and managed a global team of consultants and volunteers* Recorded dozens of hours of remote pair-programming sessions* Developed and shipped a complete single-page web app* Delivered the first new paradigm for learning programming in 20 yearsOur first app cost $20,000 cash and roughly six person-months of effort.During the final launch in December 2014, I led a team including:- one full-time paid developer- one full-time paid social media manager- two part-time paid writers (5-8 hours per week)- one volunteer tech writer (10-20 hours per week)- two volunteer web masters (5-10 hours per week)

Built and managed technology platforms to amplify the reach of Apple's Technology and Design Evangelists.WWDC Intranet* Proposed a custom web application to replace legacy off-the-shelf software for managing sessions, speakers, and scheduling for Apple's World Wide Developer Conference in 2014* Single-handedly designed, architected, and developed the application in three months using Ruby on Rails 4, PostgreSQL, and Capistrano on an internal cloud platform* Performed continuous delivery of new features and around-the-clock support for both planning and running the conference* Worked closely with the designers responsible for our Human Interface Guidelines to ensure the user interface, functionality, and workflows matched Apple's standards of excellence* Integrated Kerberos single-sign on and LDAP authorization in compliance with Apple's InfoSec policies* Exported staffing and scheduling information via JSON web services for use in ticketing, attendee displays, and the WWDC iOS app.* Added expiring announcements, user profiles, secure information hiding, calendar export, asset requests & tracking, and email integration Jive Developer Forums* Articulated vision, policies, and roadmap for Apple's Developer Forums and mailing lists* Managed and moderated forums, including building alliances with frequent posters* Setup and configured new forums, including integration with custom LDAP groups * Researched and initiated technology migration from Jive 2.6 to Jive 6, including project planning and budgeting in coordination with Apple's internal IS&T organization

recommendations: Gale Pedowitz
Cloud Software Engineer @ Intel + Nervana - Engineering Manager, DevOps, System Engineer, Apple Alumna, Troublemaker
December 14, 2015, Gale worked with Dr. Ernie in different groups

Ernie is an engineering leader with a remarkable gift for connecting with others. His technical credentials are unassailable, and he talks *with* people, not down to them. Ernie is humble, genuine, and gets things done: he was the force behind a quiet revolution at Apple, one that saw the company embrace Open Source projects, emerging technologies and scientific markets. Ernie brings out the best in teams-- in meetings, his ability to elevate the level of discourse in the room is uncanny. Ernie leads by example, and inspires others to greatness.

“Jesus follower” serving networks to multiply movements of Jesus followers
February 6, 2015, Robby worked with Dr. Ernie but at different companies

I have had the privilege of knowing Ernie for several decades and benefiting from his insights on many occasions. He is a brilliant man with proven value in the marketplace and in ministry. Yet his genuine humility makes him a joy to interact with and well-suited to team dynamics.Ernie is my go-to guy when I want help seeing a complex situation from a new perspective, whether in ministry or communication.Ernie also "gets" discipling principles which are central to God's purpose for the Church, but often sadly lacking. My greatest benefit from working with Ernie was thinking through how to communicate discipling principles in the modern church context.Ernie is a gracious and gifted innovator who will be a great asset to whatever ministry he is called to.

February 4, 2015, Andrew B. was a client of Dr. Ernie’s

Ernie possesses a deep knowledge of software and computer technology and a passion for leading teams with vision and empathy.  I first met Ernie while he was working at Apple helping to release extraordinary software platforms.  I witnessed and consulted with him as he pursued an accelerated startup focused on a unique software development effort for education.  He was able to complete the project in a short amount of time by assembling a distributed team of developers and support personnel.  Any one who works with him will benefit from his vast knowledge and software expertise as well as his strong character and value for individuals.

Daniel Ma
Steward of Programmer Experience at The Swan Factory
January 31, 2015, Daniel reported directly to Dr. Ernie

Ernie is the best boss I've ever had. He dreams big and is passionate about what he does, so he is easy to follow. He truly prioritizes people, so he is easy to trust. He creates an atmosphere that is conducive to great work because he understands the value of people being proud of their work. He is very encouraging, and happy to slow down his thought process to explain and make sure the people around him are growing and learning. If I had my way, I would keep Ernie as my boss. In the best way possible, whatever place Ernie works at will never be the same.
